metadata.Title: CVE-2014-8360 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
Directory traversal vulnerability in inc/autoload.function.php in GLPI before 0.84.8 allows remote attackers to include and execute arbitrary local files via a .._ (dot dot underscore) in an item type to the getItemForItemtype, as demonstrated by the itemtype parameter in ajax/common.tabs.php.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-8360` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

glpi - 0.84.8+dfsg.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: glpi package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.84.8+dfsg.1-1').
